title: Lippe, O’Malley, Valcarcel Heads Huskies with Eight All-MAC Selections
text:
Lippe, O’Malley, Valcarcel Heads Huskies with Eight All-MAC Selections
Northern Illinois University boasts a strong showing on the 2024 All-MAC team, with seniors J.J. Lippe, Devonte O'Malley, and Nate Valcarcel leading a total of eight Huskies honored. The team featured three first-team offensive linemen and five defensive players recognized across various levels. NIU's defensive prowess was underscored by their rankings, including leading the MAC in total defense and sacks, while the offense ranked high in yardage and rushing. Coach Thomas Hammock praised the athletes for their exceptional contributions to the program throughout the season. The Huskies, finishing with a 7-5 record, now look ahead to postseason opportunities.
By the Numbers- NIU finished second in the MAC in total offense with 383.42 yards/game.
- The Huskies ranked first in total defense, holding opponents to under 18 points/game.
While the honors garnered demonstrate improved performance, there's debate on whether consistent success in postseason play has lagged behind these individual accolades.
State of Play- The Huskies concluded the regular season with a 24-16 victory over Central Michigan.
- Bowl game announcements are due on December 8, as NIU prepares for postseason action.
Anticipation builds for NIU's bowl game destination, where their recent performance will be critical to future recruitment and program reputation.
Bottom LineWith significant recognition for key players, NIU's success highlights both individual talent and team potential, setting a hopeful tone for the upcoming postseason and future seasons.
